com.jetdrone.vertx.yoke

Class Yoke

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jetdrone.vertx.yoke.Yoke

  • public class Yoke
extends Object
    # Yoke Yoke is a chain executor of middleware for Vert.x 2.x. The goal of this library is not to provide a web application framework but the backbone that helps the creation of web applications. Yoke works in a similar way to Connect middleware. Users start by declaring which middleware components want to use and then start an http server either managed by Yoke or provided by the user (say when you need https). Yoke has no extra dependencies than Vert.x itself so it is self contained.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Yoke

        public Yoke(@NotNull
    org.vertx.java.platform.Verticle verticle)
        Creates a Yoke instance. This constructor should be called from a verticle and pass a valid Vertx instance. This instance will be shared with all registered middleware. The reason behind this is to allow middleware to use Vertx features such as file system and timers. 
         public class MyVerticle extends Verticle {
   public void start() {
     final Yoke yoke = new Yoke(this);
     ...
   }
 }
        Parameters:
        verticle - the main verticle

      • Yoke

        public Yoke(@NotNull
    org.vertx.java.core.Vertx vertx)
        Creates a Yoke instance. This constructor should be called from a verticle and pass a valid Vertx instance and a Logger. This instance will be shared with all registered middleware. The reason behind this is to allow middleware to use Vertx features such as file system and timers. 
         public class MyVerticle extends Verticle {
   public void start() {
     final Yoke yoke = new Yoke(getVertx());
     ...
   }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • vertx

        public org.vertx.java.core.Vertx vertx()

      • use

        public Yoke use(@NotNull
       String route,
       @NotNull
       IMiddleware... middleware)
        Adds a Middleware to the chain. If the middleware is an Error Handler Middleware then it is treated differently and only the last error handler is kept. You might want to add a middleware that is only supposed to run on a specific route (path prefix). In this case if the request path does not match the prefix the middleware is skipped automatically. 
         yoke.use("/login", new CustomLoginMiddleware());
        Parameters:
        route - The route prefix for the middleware
        middleware - The middleware add to the chain

      • use

        public Yoke use(@NotNull
       Middleware... middleware)
        Adds a middleware to the chain with the prefix "/".
        Parameters:
        middleware - The middleware add to the chain

      • use

        public Yoke use(@NotNull
       String route,
       @NotNull
       org.vertx.java.core.Handler<YokeRequest> handler)
        Adds a Handler to a route. The behaviour is similar to the middleware, however this will be a terminal point in the execution chain. In this case any middleware added after will not be executed. However you should care about the route which may lead to skip this middleware. The idea to user a Handler is to keep the API familiar with the rest of the Vert.x API. 
         yoke.use("/login", new Handler<YokeRequest>() {
   public void handle(YokeRequest request) {
     request.response.end("Hello");
   }
 });
        Parameters:
        route - The route prefix for the middleware
        handler - The Handler to add

      • use

        public Yoke use(@NotNull
       org.vertx.java.core.Handler<YokeRequest> handler)
        Adds a Handler to a route. 
         yoke.use("/login", new Handler<YokeRequest>() {
   public void handle(YokeRequest request) {
     request.response.end("Hello");
   }
 });
        Parameters:
        handler - The Handler to add

      • engine

        public Yoke engine(@NotNull
          Engine engine)
        Adds a Render Engine to the library. Render Engines are Template engines you might want to use to speed the development of your application. Once they are registered you can use the method render in the YokeResponse to render a template.
        Parameters:
        engine - The implementation of the engine

      • set

        public Yoke set(@NotNull
       String key,
       Object value)
        When you need to share global properties with your requests you can add them to Yoke and on every request they will be available as request.get(String)
        Parameters:
        key - unique identifier
        value - Any non null value, nulls are not saved

      • deploy

        public Yoke deploy(@NotNull
          org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonElement config)
        Deploys required middleware from a config json element. The current format for the config is either a single item or an array: 
         {
   module: String, // the name of the module
   verticle: String, // the name of the verticle (either verticle or module must be present)
   instances: Number, // how many instances, default 1
   worker: Boolean, // is it a worker verticle? default false
   multiThreaded: Boolean, // is it a multiThreaded verticle? default false
   config: JsonObject // any config you need to pass to the module/verticle
 }
        Parameters:
        config - either a json object or a json array.

      • deploy

        public Yoke deploy(@NotNull
          org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonElement config,
          org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Object> handler)
        Deploys required middleware from a config json element. The handler is only called once all middleware is deployed or in error. The order of deployment is not guaranteed since all deploy functions are called concurrently and do not wait for the previous result before deploying the next item. The current format for the config is either a single item or an array: 
         {
   module: String, // the name of the module
   verticle: String, // the name of the verticle (either verticle or module must be present)
   instances: Number, // how many instances, default 1
   worker: Boolean, // is it a worker verticle? default false
   multiThreaded: Boolean, // is it a multiThreaded verticle? default false
   config: JsonObject // any config you need to pass to the module/verticle
 }
        Parameters:
        config - either a json object or a json array.
        handler - A handler that is called once all middleware is deployed or on error.
